article: About 2:00 a.m. Monday, a California highway police officer was hit by an SUV. The officer was _ about 10 feet before landing on grass. The officer was _ a motorist whose car had broken down on the freeway. The police officer was listed in steady condition at a nearby _ . The accident occurred after the _ white SUV drove onto the shoulder where the _ cars were parked. The SUV _ the officer before ploughing into the police car. The _ of the broken car was unhurt. The SUV _ completely over. The driver climbed out of the SUV and went away ; running in the direction of a nearby _ . Because another police car was nearby, the police caught the driver _ . He was charged with _ driving, personal possessions damage, causing personal _ , and leaving the scene of a(n) _ . The driver had no license and no insurance. He had been charged with driving after drinking a year _ . At that time he had _ injured someone and escaped from the scene. He was sentenced to prison for six months. But because the prison was so overcrowded, he was  _ one month later. "What can we do?" said a policeman. "There are a lot more drunk drivers out there every night than there are _ . The only time we can get them _ the streets for ever is when they kill someone."
